original_title: Piezo Transducers Could Turn Displays Into Speakers
original_content:
Will piezoelectric-based speakers replace traditional speakers over the coming years in space-constrained devices? We have definitely seen the use of piezo transducers in e.g. high-end televisions that use the displays surface not just for the visual content, but also as a highly dynamic speaker. If you extrapolate this principle to something like smartphones, tablets and laptops the advantages are clear: piezoelectric transducers are smaller, more power efficient and do not need any holes in the enclosure. These and other advantages are what [Vineet Ganju] argues in IEEE Spectrum will push the market to adopt this new technology.
Piezoelectric transducers vibrate the display itself to create sound waves. (Credit: James Provost)
[Vineet] is the Vice President and General Manager of the audio business unit of Synaptics  which is one of the companies pushing for these piezoelectric transducers to be used for speaker purposes  so there is definitely some bias involved. Even so, its undeniable that the speakers in portable devices as well as the average flat panel TV arent exactly amazing, with the limited space meaning that audio quality suffers, with lows being generally absent and the resulting audio sounding tinny. Generally this is where people get external speakers for their TV, and lug portable speakers along with their laptop and other mobile devices.
For TVs, Sony has pushed for its Acoustic Surface Audio technology that uses two or three piezoelectric transducers on their OLED panels, while Samsung sticks to traditional speakers, but places lots of them around the screen with its Object Tracking Sound technology.
Sonys technology cannot be used with LCD panels, due to the backlight being in the way, so the interesting question here is whether the piezoelectric speaker revolution proposed by [Vineet] will be limited to devices that use OLED or similar backlight-less displays?
title: スペース制約のあるデバイスにおいて、圧電スピーカーは従来のスピーカーに取って代わるか？
body: ”スペースに制約のあるデバイスでは、圧電式スピーカーが従来のスピーカーに取って代わるかもしれません。これは、進化した高級テレビで使用されている圧電変換器の表面を視覚的なコンテンツだけでなく、非常にダイナミックなスピーカーとしても使用しているからです。スマートフォンやタブレット、ノートパソコンにも採用すると、圧電変換器の利点が明確になります：圧電変換器はより小型で、省電力で、筐体に穴を必要としません。”
titles: スペース制約のあるデバイスにおいて、圧電スピーカーは従来のスピーカーに取って代わるか？
パイゾトランスデューサーを使用したテレビなどの高級機種では、ディスプレイ自体を振動させることで音を発生させている。
圧電スピーカーの利点：小型で省電力、筐体に穴を必要としない。
圧電スピーカーの導入により、ポータブルデバイスやフラットパネルテレビの音質が向上する可能性がある。
圧電スピーカーの普及は、OLEDなどのバックライトを持たないディスプレイを搭載したデバイスに限定されるか？
